text: Apple just unveiled the newest iPhone
and it sounds great except it has that
same storage problem we saw last year at
the iPhone 6 and I think it's gonna be a
problem for you too here's why first of
all we call the apps and games and
photos videos and even text messages you
store on your phone you're gonna use up
that 16 gigabytes pretty quickly
meanwhile other phones like those from
Apple's rival Samsung start at 32
gigabytes which is just enough storage
for most people and as we learned last
year it can be really tough for people
to upgrade to the new version of iOS if
they don't have enough storage on their
phone Apple says 16 gigabytes is enough
storage for a lot of people mostly
because you're gonna be storing things
online through their cloud service
iCloud but I don't quite buy that
argument because they don't have the
best track record when it comes to
storing data online and they only give
you a measly amount of storage with your
iPhone 32 gigabytes would normally be
enough storage for most people but Apple
does even bother to offer that model
instead it goes from 16 gigabytes to 64
gigabytes to 128 gigabytes so even if
you consider yourself a modest iPhone
user and don't store a lot of apps games
and photos on your device that 16
gigabytes is going to get used up really
quick so do yourself a favor now and get
ready to spend a little bit extra on
your next iPhone and go for the 64
gigabyte version instead
